channel.title: How does uploading work?
channel.description: Hey guys I'm new here and learning. I recently downloaded a source and a client. When I go to upload the client so others can join, is there anything i need to do to the client? I'm saying this becuase I think every one downloads same client so me uploading it will do me no good. Please tell me if you don't under stand, and ty in advanced.

item.title: How does uploading work?
item.dc:creator: @XMikEIX XMikEIX
item.description:
@XMikEIX wrote:

public static String server = “mworld.no-ip.biz”; // ip - 127.0.0.1 localhost

^That is correct sir.

mworld.no-ip.biz = someone elses server
127.0.0.1 = That’s you, if you connect to that, you will connect to your server, but other people can’t connect to your server from that IP.

www.no-ip.com
www.ipchicken.com

Find ur IP and ipchicken, sign up at no-ip.com, add new host, type in ur IP, get your no-ip and use it in ur client.

Sorry im in a rush lol

Read full topic

item.title: How does uploading work?
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

You should find something like

System.out.println("Connecting to update server"); Serverip = "0.0.0.0"; sign.signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getByName(Serverip));

Look for something similar to that.

Read full topic

item.title: How does uploading work?
item.dc:creator: @yeoldhag yeoldhag
item.description:
@yeoldhag wrote:

IM having trouble finding the gui.java

EDITS:
would that be it?

public static String server = “mworld.no-ip.biz”; // ip - 127.0.0.1 localhost

Read full topic

item.title: How does uploading work?
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

Client folder find gui.java. Open it up at press ctrl + f; look for:

serverip="

There will be something inbetween those brackets. Usually 0.0.0.0, 127.0.0.1 or the person’s old server ip. Change it to the custom IP address that you have made and that will allow the people who downloaded your client to access your server.

Read full topic
